conclusion: Identify states from the p-V diagram: State A (p ≈ 1.0 × 10⁵ Pa, V ≈ 8 × 10⁻³ m³), State B (p ≈ 2.0 × 10⁵ Pa, V ≈ 6 × 10⁻³ m³), State C (p ≈ 3.0 × 10⁵ Pa, V ≈ 3 × 10⁻³ m³)
Use the ideal gas law PV = nRT to relate the states
Convert the given temperature to Kelvin: Temperature in state A = 27°C = 300 K
Find the temperature in state B using the ratio: T_B = (P_B V_B T_A) / (P_A V_A)
Substitute the values to calculate T_B: T_B = (2.0 × 6 × 300) / (1.0 × 8) = 450 K
Convert temperature back to Celsius: T_B = 450 K - 273 = 177°C
Final answer: The temperature of the gas in state B is 450 K or 177°C
